newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian shares dip again, trade picks up.
newsitem.headline: Estonian shares dip again, trade picks up.

text.p: Estonian shares slipped lower again on Tuesday as overall market trade picked up some more steam, the bourse said.
Turnover on the official list was 38.75 million kroons and the Tallinn stock exchange index fell 0.75 percent to 129.85.
Market leader Hansapank was again the most actively traded on turnover of 14.6 million kroons and it closed slightly lower at 131.25 kroons versus 131.55 kroons.
Savings Bank was also actively traded on business of just under 10 million kroons as its stock also slipped to 60 kroons from 60.10 kroons.
Tallinn Pharmaceutical was amongst the other active shares and traded 7.23 million kroons. It rose to 70.25 kroons from 69.50 kroons.
The company earlier reported that its net profit for the first 10 months of the year came to 21 million kroons, a rise of just below three million kroons from the nine-month level.
On the secondary market, total trade came to 5.3 million kroons and the Norma plastics firm was the most active on turnover of 1.6 million kroons. It was stable at 31.70 kroons.
The Rakevere meat processing plant was also busy on trade of 1.3 million kroons and the stock rose slightly to 6.90 kroons from 6.85 kroons.
